text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to assert that an injunction from a New York court automatically invalidates a Paris-seated arbitration. The candidate answer does the exact opposite: it argues that the injunction was improper, that the tribunal was not bound by it (as it is governed by French law), and that refusing enforcement based on the violation of that injunction would violate the pro-enforcement bias of the New York Convention. Therefore, the response does not satisfy the negative condition described in the criterion.", "criterion_id": "de5ab140-8126-4615-aadf-578d40e44047"}
